channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: A Convolutional Vision Transformer for Semantic Segmentation of Side-Scan Sonar Data
item.description: To overcome the lack of CNN-like inductive biases, thereby making ViTs more conducive to applications in low data regimes, we propose a novel feature extraction module to replace the Multi-layer Perceptron (MLP) block within transformer layers and a novel module to extract multiscale patch embeddings.

item.title: COVERED, CollabOratiVE Robot Environment Dataset for 3D Semantic segmentation
item.description: Despite the importance of semantic understanding for such applications, 3D semantic segmentation of collaborative robot workspaces lacks sufficient research and dedicated datasets.

item.title: Provably Efficient Neural Offline Reinforcement Learning via Perturbed Rewards
item.description: We propose a novel offline reinforcement learning (RL) algorithm, namely Value Iteration with Perturbed Rewards (VIPeR) which amalgamates the randomized value function idea with the pessimism principle.

item.title: Defending Against Backdoor Attacks by Layer-wise Feature Analysis
item.description: We find out that the feature difference between benign and poisoned samples tends to be maximum at a critical layer, which is not always the one typically used in existing defenses, namely the layer before fully-connected layers.

item.title: Neural Laplace Control for Continuous-time Delayed Systems
item.description: Many real-world offline reinforcement learning (RL) problems involve continuous-time environments with delays.

item.title: Implicit Temporal Reasoning for Evidence-Based Fact-Checking
item.description: Our findings show that the presence of temporal information and the manner in which timelines are constructed greatly influence how fact-checking models determine the relevance and supporting or refuting character of evidence documents.

item.title: HULAT at SemEval-2023 Task 9: Data augmentation for pre-trained transformers applied to Multilingual Tweet Intimacy Analysis
item.description: During the development phase, our best results were obtained by using XLM-T. Data augmentation techniques provide a very slight improvement in the results.

item.title: Improving Massively Multilingual ASR With Auxiliary CTC Objectives
item.description: In this paper, we introduce our work on improving performance on FLEURS, a 102-language open ASR benchmark, by conditioning the entire model on language identity (LID).

item.title: SurvivalGAN: Generating Time-to-Event Data for Survival Analysis
item.description: SurvivalGAN outperforms multiple baselines at generating survival data, and in particular addresses the failure modes as measured by the new metrics, in addition to improving downstream performance of survival models trained on the synthetic data.

item.title: A Targeted Accuracy Diagnostic for Variational Approximations
item.description: Variational Inference (VI) is an attractive alternative to Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) due to its computational efficiency in the case of large datasets and/or complex models with high-dimensional parameters.

item.title: Membership Inference Attacks against Synthetic Data through Overfitting Detection
item.description: In this work we argue for a realistic MIA setting that assumes the attacker has some knowledge of the underlying data distribution.

item.title: ProofNet: Autoformalizing and Formally Proving Undergraduate-Level Mathematics
item.description: We introduce ProofNet, a benchmark for autoformalization and formal proving of undergraduate-level mathematics.

item.title: Improving the Data Efficiency of Multi-Objective Quality-Diversity through Gradient Assistance and Crowding Exploration
item.description: We show that MOME-PGX is between 4. 3 and 42 times more data-efficient than MOME and doubles the performance of MOME, NSGA-II and SPEA2 in challenging environments.

item.title: Towards Stable Test-Time Adaptation in Dynamic Wild World
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the unstable reasons and find that the batch norm layer is a crucial factor hindering TTA stability.

item.title: Active Membership Inference Attack under Local Differential Privacy in Federated Learning
item.description: Federated learning (FL) was originally regarded as a framework for collaborative learning among clients with data privacy protection through a coordinating server.

item.title: LLaMA: Open and Efficient Foundation Language Models
item.description: We introduce LLaMA, a collection of foundation language models ranging from 7B to 65B parameters.

item.title: STA: Self-controlled Text Augmentation for Improving Text Classifications
item.description: Despite recent advancements in Machine Learning, many tasks still involve working in low-data regimes which can make solving natural language problems difficult.

item.title: T-Phenotype: Discovering Phenotypes of Predictive Temporal Patterns in Disease Progression
item.description: Clustering time-series data in healthcare is crucial for clinical phenotyping to understand patients' disease progression patterns and to design treatment guidelines tailored to homogeneous patient subgroups.

item.title: GANterfactual-RL: Understanding Reinforcement Learning Agents' Strategies through Visual Counterfactual Explanations
item.description: However, research focusing on counterfactual explanations, specifically for RL agents with visual input, is scarce and does not go beyond identifying defective agents.

item.title: Language-Driven Representation Learning for Robotics
item.description: First, we demonstrate that existing representations yield inconsistent results across these tasks: masked autoencoding approaches pick up on low-level spatial features at the cost of high-level semantics, while contrastive learning approaches capture the opposite.

item.title: Emotion Prediction Oriented method with Multiple Supervisions for Emotion-Cause Pair Extraction
item.description: Emotion-cause pair extraction (ECPE) task aims to extract all the pairs of emotions and their causes from an unannotated emotion text.

item.title: UnbiasedNets: A Dataset Diversification Framework for Robustness Bias Alleviation in Neural Networks
item.description: In contrast, UnbiasedNets provides a notable improvement over existing works, while even reducing the robustness bias significantly in some cases, as observed by comparing the NNs trained on the diversified and original datasets.

item.title: Slate-Aware Ranking for Recommendation
item.description: Therefore, the ranking stage is still essential for most applications to provide high-quality candidate set for the re-ranking stage.

item.title: Retrospective Uncertainties for Deep Models using Vine Copulas
item.description: Despite the major progress of deep models as learning machines, uncertainty estimation remains a major challenge.

item.title: Improving Sentence Similarity Estimation for Unsupervised Extractive Summarization
item.description: Unsupervised extractive summarization aims to extract salient sentences from a document as the summary without labeled data.

item.title: Scalable Unbalanced Sobolev Transport for Measures on a Graph
item.description: We show that the proposed unbalanced Sobolev transport (UST) admits a closed-form formula for fast computation, and it is also negative definite.

item.title: Retrieved Sequence Augmentation for Protein Representation Learning
item.description: RSA links query protein sequences to a set of sequences with similar structures or properties in the database and combines these sequences for downstream prediction.

item.title: In-Depth Look at Word Filling Societal Bias Measures
item.description: Many measures of societal bias in language models have been proposed in recent years.

item.title: On the Limitations of Physics-informed Deep Learning: Illustrations Using First Order Hyperbolic Conservation Law-based Traffic Flow Models
item.description: Detailed in the case study, we present the contradistinction in PIDL results between learning the traffic flow model (LWR PDE) and its variation with diffusion.

item.title: Solving differential equations using physics informed deep learning: a hand-on tutorial with benchmark tests
item.description: We revisit the original approach of using deep learning and neural networks to solve differential equations by incorporating the knowledge of the equation.

item.title: Object-Centric Video Prediction via Decoupling of Object Dynamics and Interactions
item.description: We propose a novel framework for the task of object-centric video prediction, i. e., extracting the compositional structure of a video sequence, as well as modeling objects dynamics and interactions from visual observations in order to predict the future object states, from which we can then generate subsequent video frames.

item.title: Multi-Paradigm Analysis of Thai Capital Market Linkages: Bivariate/Vine Copulas, Granger Causality, Network Centrality, and Graph Neural Network/Graph Embedding Approaches
item.description: Analytically thorough understanding of causal, probabilistic, and informational linkages amongst modern, highly-interconnected capital markets is fundamental to the promotion of capital-market innovation, efficiency, and resilience; whereupon innovative, efficient, and resilient capital markets are fundamental to the sustainable economic development of any nation and the robust financial stability of her economy.

item.title: SPINDLE: Spinning Raw Text into Lambda Terms with Graph Attention
item.description: This paper describes SPINDLE - an open source Python module implementing an efficient and accurate parser for written Dutch that transforms raw text input to programs for meaning composition, expressed as {\lambda} terms.

item.title: Auditing for Spatial Fairness
item.description: Similar to established notions of algorithmic fairness, we define spatial fairness as the statistical independence of outcomes from location.

item.title: Understanding the Impact of Competing Events on Heterogeneous Treatment Effect Estimation from Time-to-Event Data
item.description: We study the problem of inferring heterogeneous treatment effects (HTEs) from time-to-event data in the presence of competing events.

item.title: In What Languages are Generative Language Models the Most Formal? Analyzing Formality Distribution across Languages
item.description: Multilingual generative language models (LMs) are increasingly fluent in a large variety of languages.

item.title: Set Features for Fine-grained Anomaly Detection
item.description: Fine-grained anomaly detection has recently been dominated by segmentation based approaches.

item.title: Improving Adaptive Conformal Prediction Using Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: However, the use of self-supervision beyond model pretraining and representation learning has been largely unexplored.

item.title: A Neural Span-Based Continual Named Entity Recognition Model
item.description: Named Entity Recognition (NER) models capable of Continual Learning (CL) are realistically valuable in areas where entity types continuously increase (e. g., personal assistants).

item.title: FTM: A Frame-level Timeline Modeling Method for Temporal Graph Representation Learning
item.description: Existing neighborhood aggregation strategies fail to capture either the short-term features or the long-term features of temporal graph attributes, leading to unsatisfactory model performance and even poor robustness and domain generality of the representation learning method.

item.title: Teacher Intervention: Improving Convergence of Quantization Aware Training for Ultra-Low Precision Transformers
item.description: Pre-trained Transformer models such as BERT have shown great success in a wide range of applications, but at the cost of substantial increases in model complexity.

item.title: Change is Hard: A Closer Look at Subpopulation Shift
item.description: Machine learning models often perform poorly on subgroups that are underrepresented in the training data.

item.title: MCWDST: a Minimum-Cost Weighted Directed Spanning Tree Algorithm for Real-Time Fake News Mitigation in Social Media
item.description: The widespread availability of internet access and handheld devices confers to social media a power similar to the one newspapers used to have.

item.title: Bayesian Structure Scores for Probabilistic Circuits
item.description: Probabilistic circuits (PCs) are a prominent representation of probability distributions with tractable inference.

item.title: Targeted Search Control in AlphaZero for Effective Policy Improvement
item.description: AlphaZero trains upon self-play matches beginning from the initial state of a game and only samples actions over the first few moves, limiting its exploration of states deeper in the game tree.

item.title: FiTs: Fine-grained Two-stage Training for Knowledge-aware Question Answering
item.description: Despite the promising result of recent KAQA systems which tend to integrate linguistic knowledge from pre-trained language models (PLM) and factual knowledge from knowledge graphs (KG) to answer complex questions, a bottleneck exists in effectively fusing the representations from PLMs and KGs because of (i) the semantic and distributional gaps between them, and (ii) the difficulties in joint reasoning over the provided knowledge from both modalities.

item.title: Uncertainty Guided Ensemble Self-Training for Semi-Supervised Global Field Reconstruction
item.description: Recovering a globally accurate complex physics field from limited sensor is critical to the measurement and control in the aerospace engineering.

item.title: MesoGraph: Automatic Profiling of Malignant Mesothelioma Subtypes from Histological Images
item.description: Tissue is represented by a cell graph with both cell-level morphological and regional features.

item.title: Side Adapter Network for Open-Vocabulary Semantic Segmentation
item.description: A side network is attached to a frozen CLIP model with two branches: one for predicting mask proposals, and the other for predicting attention bias which is applied in the CLIP model to recognize the class of masks.

item.title: Quantifying & Modeling Feature Interactions: An Information Decomposition Framework
item.description: The recent explosion of interest in multimodal applications has resulted in a wide selection of datasets and methods for representing and integrating information from different signals.
